question: Who is the Chairperson of the Start-up Advisory Council, constituted recently?
explanation:
The Start-up Advisory Council was notified in January 2020, which aims to advise the Government to nurture innovation and start-ups in the country. It is chaired by the Commerce and Industry Minister.
The Centre has recently nominated 28 non-official members for the Start-up Advisory Council notified last year, including the founders of top start-up firms in the country including Byjuâ€™s, Urban Company, Snapdeal and Ola Cabs.
